name: 3-fluoro-4-methoxybenzenesulfonamide
Reason: 3-fluoro-4-methoxybenzenesulfonamide has a melting point that can be predicted by analyzing the functional groups present in the molecule. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The fluorine atom (F) increases the melting point by approximately +10°C due to increased molecular weight and electronegativity. The methoxy group (–O–) introduces a hydrogen bond acceptor, which can increase the melting point by approximately +20°C. The sulfonamide group (–SO2N–) can participate in hydrogen bonding, which can raise the melting point by approximately +30°C. The sulfur atom also introduces a rigid structure, which can contribute to the melting point.
